detail_copy: The temporary street circuit, located on the Detroit River, Belle Isle has hosted a multitude of auto races since first opening in 1992, including IMSA sportscar and Indycar. The 2.35 mile, 13-turn circuit is located on a picturesque island minutes from downtown Detroit. The digital replica of the track highlights the beautiful landscape, most notably the fountain near turns 9 and 10, the Detroit skyline and views into Canada. The racing surface is very unique and features smooth concrete, worn/polished concrete, new and old asphalt. The multiple surface types challenges drivers as they discover where they can push and where they need to be cautious.
